ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] What does the ".invalid" suffix on an ARC file mean?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... The .invalid is added when we get any IOException writing an arc record.  The ARC is closed and given the .invalid suffix. The 29 gz.opens is odd.

Tom Emerson wrote:

> My big crawl died: WUI completely unresponsive (could not even
> connect). Logs indicate memory problems. I'm left with 29 (!) arc
> files with the ".gz.open" suffix (when only 5 were in the pool) and 5
> arc files with the ".gz.invalid" suffix. What does .invalid mean
> (besides the obvious connotation that these are, well, invalid, which
> they are, according to gunzip --test).
>
> Thirteen of the 29 of the .open ARCs are 0-length.
>
The '.invalid' is added when we get any IOException writing an arc 
record.  The ARC is closed and given the '.invalid' suffix.

The 29 'gz.opens' is odd.  Are your disks healthy Tom?  (dmesg?)  Did 
you run out of disk space?

St.Ack
